discover.instruction: Read about my classroom. Notice the highlighted plural words.
discover.instruction_ru: Прочитай о моём классе. Обрати внимание на выделенные слова во множественном числе.

content.text: In my classroom, there are twenty <highlight>students</highlight>. We have many <highlight>desks</highlight> and <highlight>chairs</highlight>. On the wall, there are two <highlight>clocks</highlight> and three <highlight>maps</highlight>. The teacher has many <highlight>books</highlight>. Some <highlight>children</highlight> bring their <highlight>lunches</highlight> to school. We also have two <highlight>boxes</highlight> of <highlight>pencils</highlight>. The <highlight>women</highlight> teachers are very kind. There are some <highlight>mice</highlight> in the old classroom!
content.question: How do we make plural nouns? What patterns do you see?
content.question_ru: Как мы образуем множественное число? Какие закономерности ты видишь?

points.example: book → books, car → cars, dog → dogs

points.rule: Nouns ending in s, ss, sh, ch, x, o: add -es
points.rule_ru: После s, ss, sh, ch, x, o: добавляем -es
points.example: bus → buses, box → boxes, watch → watches, tomato → tomatoes

points.rule: Nouns ending in consonant + y: change y to ies
points.rule_ru: Согласная + y: меняем y на ies
points.example: city → cities, baby → babies, country → countries

points.rule: Nouns ending in vowel + y: add -s
points.example: day → days, boy → boys, key → keys
man → men, woman → women, child → children, foot → feet, tooth → teeth, mouse → mice, person → people

notice.instruction: Find all plural nouns and identify the rule used.
notice.instruction_ru: Найди все существительные во множественном числе и определи правило.

tasks.text: I have two cats and three dogs. My cats love boxes. They play with toys all day. I live with my parents in a house. We have five rooms. My brothers have many hobbies. They play video games. On weekends, we visit our friends. We eat sandwiches and watch movies.

questions.sentence: There are many ___ in the park.

produce.instruction: Write 5 sentences about things you have (using plurals).
produce.instruction_ru: Напиши 5 предложений о вещах, которые у тебя есть (используя множественное число).
prompts: How many books/pens/phones do you have?
produce.example: I have many books on my shelf. I have two cats. In my bag, there are three pens and two notebooks. My room has two windows. I have three brothers.
criteria: Uses at least one irregular plural

input_flood.description: Read 5 texts with many plural nouns.

texts.title: My Collections
texts.content: I love collecting things. I have 50 stamps from different countries. I also have 20 coins from many cities. My sister has dolls. She has 15 dolls! My brother collects cars. He has toy cars from Japan. We keep our collections in boxes.

texts.title: At the Market
texts.content: I went to the market. I bought apples, oranges, and bananas. I also got tomatoes and potatoes. The market has many shops. I saw some ladies selling flowers. Children were eating sandwiches. Men were carrying boxes.

texts.title: School Supplies
texts.content: For school, I need many things. I have pencils, pens, and erasers. I carry books in my bag. I also have notebooks for classes. My teachers give us exercises. We do homework in the evenings.

texts.title: The Zoo
texts.content: The zoo has many animals. There are lions, tigers, and elephants. I saw monkeys eating bananas. Children love watching the animals. There are fish in the pond. Some birds are colorful. The zoo has maps for visitors.

texts.title: Family Party
texts.content: We had a family party. Many people came. There were men, women, and children. We made sandwiches and cakes. The babies were sleeping. The kids played games. We took photos. It was one of the best parties ever.

grammar_cards.front:
Find the error:
"I saw many mouses."
grammar_cards.back:
I saw many mice.

mouse → mice (irregular)

keys

vowel + y → just add s

common_errors: Adding -s after x, ch, sh (boxs instead of boxes)
Not changing y to ies (citys instead of cities)
